alert.note: Alert for Eastern Lassen County; Surprise Valley California; Western Lassen, Eastern Plumas, and Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued August 15 at 3:11PM PDT until August 18 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT WEDNESDAY THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING ON DRY FUELS FOR NORTHEAST CALIFORNIA AND FAR NORTHWEST NEVADA... The National Weather Service in Reno has issued a Fire Weather Watch for abundant lightning on dry fuels, which is in effect from Wednesday afternoon through late Wednesday night. * Affected Area...Fire Zone 270 Surprise Valley California, Fire Zone 271 Western Lassen, Eastern Plumas, and Eastern Sierra Counties, Fire Zone 278 Eastern Lassen County and Fire Zone 458 Northern Washoe County. * Thunderstorms...Scattered mix of wet and dry thunderstorms Wednesday afternoon, then nocturnal storms possible Wednesday night. Storms will transition wetter on Thursday. * Impacts...Lightning can create new fire starts and may combine with strong outflow winds up to 50 mph which could cause a fire to rapidly grow in size and intensity before first responders can contain them.
info.instruction: Avoid outdoor activities that can cause a spark near dry vegetation, such as yard work, target shooting, or campfires. Follow local fire restrictions. Check weather.gov/reno for updates and livingwithfire.info for preparedness tips.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Lassen County; Surprise Valley California; Western Lassen, Eastern Plumas, and Eastern Sierra Counties
